Tesla sales slump - but shares spike on report Musk leaving Dogehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/tesla-sales-slump-but-slump-but-spike-on-report-on-report-musk-leaving-doge/cvkqyfr7fjanlenmijvhjec2he/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/tesla-sales-slump-but-slump-but-spike-on-report-on-report-musk-leaving-doge/cvkqyfr7fjanlenmijvhjec2he/ Analyst calls the sales figures 'a disaster on every metric'. Wed, 02 Apr 2025 19:30:55 +0000 Tesla chief executive Elon Musk with US President Donald Trump on March 11. Trump said he'll buy a new Tesla to support Elon Musk, after shares of the electric-car maker had their worst day in four years amid a growing backlash over Musk's political allegiances. Photo / Getty Images
